finding: ITP, formerly known as idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura, is a rare haematological disorder triggered by viral infections.
Most cases of ITP are benign, with only minor mucosal bleeding as the main presentation.
Severe ITP can cause intracranial haemorrhage, as reported in a case of ITP following infection with a coronavirus.
Intravenous immunoglobulin and steroids are very effective treatments for severe ITP.
The exact mechanism of ITP is poorly understood, but viral infections are thought to trigger the disease through autoimmune destruction of platelets or inhibition of synthesis.
